Portal is a great game, absolutely recommend playing it.
Despite being a short game, it manages to pack in an interesting story, extensive lore (which is further pushed by the sequel), and fun game play which is able to teach the player basic mechanics seamlessly, without having to even give a proper tutorial. If you've been thinking about buying Portal, I 100% recommend it. Hell, buy the Portal bundle too! It gets you both Portal 1 and Portal 2 for 14.99 USD. Portal and Portal 2 are excellent games that I just wish everyone could play at some point in their lives.

Ce jeu est gÃ©nial. Il mÃ©lange l'univers fictif ( portails dimensionnels ) avec des agiles casse-tÃªtes. 
De plus, on dÃ©couvre de plus en plus sur Glados, l'antagoniste principal, au fil de l'histoire.
Excellent jeu, que je recommande sans aucun doute ^^.

Portal is a great game that combined two things I'd never seen mix(especially so well), puzzles, and FPS gameplay. Each test chamber is different and creative, this game is hard, but not hard to the point where I couldn't figure it out, sometimes I solved them by just walking around the chamber and thinking. Most puzzle games I get frustrated by and end up quitting or consulting a walkthrough, but Portal was just the right difficulty where it's hard but not frustratingly so. The gameplay is exceptional, its fun to see the vast capabilities of the portals, and the games physics. The small amount of story and dialogue we get is very good and left me wanting more. It can be mind bending at moments but it forces you to think outside the box to do things, and I really enjoyed it. The challenge test chambers are pretty good as well, however I did struggle with them quite a bit, but it's possible to solve them if you spend enough time on it. The games only fault is it being so short. It feels more like a demo for Portal 2, than a real game. All in all 9/10, great game!
